title: Social Enterprise Research Cluster (SERC)
abstractText:
Social Enterprise Capacity Building Cluster, funded by ESRC and Office of Civil Society. The Economic and Social Research Council, (ESRC) and Office of Civil Society, (OTS) have awarded a joint social enterprise £1million research grant to Middlesex University, London South Bank University and Durham University to carry out a 5 year research programme on social enterprise.

The consortium will use the grant to fund training for researchers on social enterprise issues and to develop links between universities and social enterprises. Social enterprises are organisations that are trading with a social purpose. They include charities, cooperatives and other organisations that do not distribute profit to shareholders.

The bid will develop four components:

  1. CASE PhD Studentships
  2. Knowledge Transfer Partnerships
  3. Placements 
  4. Vouchers.

Social enterprises can join the cluster activities through co-funding activities, and join the existing partners from across the sector who have committed to building up the research capacity.
